comprehensive_overview: ISL (Integer Set Library) is a library for manipulating sets and maps of integer points bounded by linear constraints. It provides functions for computing the integer points in a set or projection of a set represented as unions of polyhedra, as wells as their images under affine transformations.
core_features:
- Manipulating sets and maps of integer points
- Computing integer points in a set
- Intersection and union operations
- Projection of a set
- Affine transformations
